Sentence: It seems I may have used the flash accidentally once or twice (I keep it off) but if I depended on it I might be a little wary of its constant popping up as I'm sure its just a flimsy, plastic rack and pinion mechanism.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: The location of the flash is unfortunate in that it pops into left my hand as I try to shoot...the only other hand-hold would seem to be cupping the body from below, or shooting one-handed.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: Again not using the flash makes this a non-issue for me, I'd be just as happy if Canon left the flash off entirely or at least integrated it into the body to simplify the design.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: Other reviewers have criticized the battery life...this hasn't been much of an issue for me.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: I keep the camera off between shots, have the LCD turned down a bit, rarely use the movie mode and flash, so I can get perhaps three days of casual shooting off a single charge.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: A full heavy day of shooting will drain the battery, but I can live with that.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: If you were taking this camera on an extended trip to some remote locale a spare battery would be a necessity.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: As I keep it off when I'm not shooting it does take a bit longer than feels necessary to start up and auto-focus when I want shoot: maybe 3-4 secs or so.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: When you're in a hurry to catch something that can feel like a long delay.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: Overall this is an excellent camera that puts all the functions I wanted (RAW shooting, wide lens, full suite of manual settings and f-stop adjustments) and then some in my back pocket.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: There's certainly better cameras out there (the G11 is only marginally more expensive), but none I'd want to haul around on a daily basis.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: Hopefully somebody at Canon is checking these product reviews and the next generation S90 will feel like the smooth, solidly-built slab of metal the older PowerShots were.
Name: electronics_pos_33

Sentence: I've been a Neil Finn fan practically my whole adult life.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: First I become exposed to his brilliance via I Got You, the break through song of Split Enz a quarter of a century ago.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: That album, True Colours, is jam packed with great melodies and fun arrangements.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: Although their later albums did not match that peak, they were still enjoyable.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: When Crowded House became huge, I liked their albums ever more.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: Their first one, despite including the classic Don't Dream It's Over, is their least interesting one but during the final album, Together Alone, Neil Finn and Crowded House were making among the best music of that era.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: Before hearing the album in its entirety, I heard She Will Have Her Way and Sinner, both great tracks and worthy classics.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: She Will is a straight forward song in a Beatles-esque fashion whilst Sinner is a dark moody track with a haunting rhythm.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: Sadly, these were the only tracks worth any attention.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: The songs really never come to life.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: I tried several times listening to the album, hoping I would get it, but no, this is for me an album that lacked a creative spark, something I can't say about anything else I had heard by Neil Finn (his next studio album, live album and recent one with his brother are for example much better).
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: Actually, this is the only Neil Finn release that has not been a favorite of mine.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: It is interesting but this album gets high marks from many reviewers, actually most reviewers.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: My sister and one of my best friends are also big Neil Finn fans.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: Their reaction to this album was, however, almost identical to mine, close to being boring and not living up to expectations.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: It was also a commercial failure so it will remain a mystery to me how many people enjoy it.
Name: music_neg_7

Sentence: My advice, however, is to leave this one alone and listen to practically everything else by Neil Finn.
Name: music_neg_7

Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: It took me not a whole lot longer than zero seconds to realize that something was wrong.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: The starting crushing interplay of bass & drums on Come Back and Stay is nowhere to be heard, the songs simply "starts".
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: When I heard that the middle section where Paul sings "Since You've Been Gone...." is truncated did I realize that this is the single version being used, NOT the original album version.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: Things get worse: Love Will Tear Us Apart is presented here without the intro on the original album, again it simply "starts".
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: Similar story with Love of the Common People, the long intro on the album has been shortened, similar as to the single version although I am not sure whether its identical, it is a bit longer than the version on his Time compilation.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: I think/hope I have spotted all the faults.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: The production at the time was revolutionary; Lauri Latham (later worked with Echo & the Bunnymen, Squeeze and The Stranglers) came with a distinctive glossy and crisp sound.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: Although it became soon dated, it sounds today very fresh.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: The re-mastering is good, it is as if the tapes were cleaned with the separation much clearer.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: The music has also aged well, Paul Young's voice still gives me goose bumps.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: In whole, a major disappointment due to shortened versions, and simply baffling since it is stated that this IS the original album.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: I thus give it only three stars, which may be generous.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: Any comments, especially from someone responsible for this re-release would be welcomed.
Name: music_neu_24

Sentence: Paramore just recently broke into the scene and have become very well known in a very short amount of time.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: Led by 17 year old vocalist Hayley Williams, the band also features guitarist Josh Farro, drummer Zac Farro, bassist Jeremy Davis, and rhythm guitarist Hunter Lamb, all under the age of 21. The album starts with "All We Know", a catchy (but straightforward, systemaic) power-pop song.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: "Pressure" has the surefire sound of a ready for MTV single, and will definitely have a lot of kids heads bobbing at Warped Tour and on their headlining tour this summer.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: "Emergency" and "Brighter" both show that the band knows how to craft catchy pop-rock songs.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: "Here We Go Again" demonstrates that not all of Paramore is just vocals and catchy choruses.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: Farro's guitar in this song is impressive and incredibly catchy, showing that this band will probably be hanging around the scene for awhile.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: "Never Let This Go" is a welcome change of pace to the album, and the melody kind of reminds me of "The War" by Melee, though LOOSELY.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: The song starts slow and then builds into a great chorus as Williams sings "Please don't get me wrong, because I'll never let this go, but I can't find the words to tell you I don't wanna be alone, but now I feel like I don't know you", and then it's right back to the soft guitars and drums.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: Definitely one of the better tracks on the album.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: "Whoa" has the most simplistic lyrics of any song on the album, but it'll definitely be fun to dance along to at shows.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: "Consipracy" and "Franklin" also have basic lyrics, with the first being about someone losing power in a relationship, and the next being about going back to your hometown after awhile and everything (mostly peoples' reactions to you) being different.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: The songs aren't going to win any awards from "lyric-lovers", but they are, as the entire album has been, catchy.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: These few songs show the age of the band the most, but I'm sure as they grow their lyrics will grow with them.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: The closer, "My Heart", reminds me a lot of "Some Will Seek Forgiveness...
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: Others Escape" by Underoath, because the song starts slow, seems to be another basic song just like the last two, but at the end Josh adds some screams and it really makes for a pumped up ending to the album.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: 'All We Know Is Falling' is a sing and dance along album that will get stuck in your head.
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: This band has such potential to go far: down-to-earth kids who love to hang out with their fans, catchy albums and they put on a fun and impressive live show (I was very surprised).
Name: music_pos_25

Sentence: I think, if you give this band a couple years, they have a chance to be real heavyweights in the emo/pop-rock scene, and will be selling out large venues soon.

Sentence: First and foremost, this is psychedelic rock built on a strong pop framework.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: A first-time listener might guess this was an undiscovered gem originating from London, circa 1968. From then on, it becomes a game of "spot-the-reference".
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: The early Who, Pretty Things, Love, Moody Blues, the Beatles, 13th Floor Elevators, and any number of the 60s British one-hit wonders would probably come to mind.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: Combine all of them, get Thurston Moore to play (a real) melody lead on electric guitar, add a bit of distortion, and you begin to get the idea.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: Sixties-wise, it has all the right elements: layered guitars, reverb, echo, jangle, phasing and harmonies.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: And Brian Leary's voice is the perfect accompaniment to it all, pulling it all together like Rain Parade did in their best moments.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: Though Scrapbook resembles 60s psychedelia, it doesn't feel dated in the least; this is no doubt due to the updated post-rock guitar sound that appears throughout.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: There are a few straightforward pop songs; I would defy anyone to listen to "Your Kind Turn Me All Around" without catching it flying sorties around your brain a day later.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: Other songs, including "Eyes", "Masses of Tiny Dots", "All of the Lovely Sounds" and "Color It" are closer to garage proto- psych/punk.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: The albums opus is "Sea Map", which straddles some nether-ground between Led Zeppelin, Bardo Pond and Porcupine Tree. This is balanced by the delicate beauty of "Scrapbook of Madness" and "Satellite Sun".
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: And there's a hint of Beatles flavour to "When the Ancients Fly".
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: It's a diverse album, moody, brilliant and completely satisfying.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: The album was good enough to make me go and locate all Polyphemus material I could find.
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: And if you enjoy this, watch for their next incarnation: "Gangster Hippie".
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: I've heard the first GH album, and it's equally amazing...
Name: music_pos_29

Sentence: I really wanted to "love" Chaos Legion. It had a lot of the right ingredients for a killer action game - creepy monsters, stylish combos, and lots of frenetic hack-'n'-slash melee fighting.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: How could this possibly have gone wrong?
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: Well, let's see...For starters, the pacing of the game is very uneven.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: You'll often find yourself trapped in a closed arena withhordes of monsters, just needing to find the right combination of Legions (your demonic partners in this game) to kill 'em all and move on.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: Rinse, repeat, add water if necessary.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: This sort of stop-and-go fighting takes away from the sense of danger that a game like this is supposed to have.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: The graphics don't do this game justice, either.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: Throughout most of the game, you'll be surrounded by drab castle walls (which is forgivable, given the game's setting), and many shades of gray (or black, should you stick around long enough to venture into the later levels).
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: There's also an RPG element to the game, which allows you to increase the levels of your Legions to give them more powerful and varied attacks.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: But since you can only upgrade your Legions between levels, and it takes such a ridiculous amount of EXP to earn even the most basic of upgrades, it hardly seems worth it in the end.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: Okay, so Chaos Legion isn't an incredibly BAD game...it's just not very exciting, either.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: Fans of the mindless hack-'n'-slash might just like this one as a rental.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: Everyone else should steer clear.
Name: videogames_neu_9

Sentence: The story is nothing to die for, but is alright.

Sentence: I suppose this game is just the icing on the cake after Squares last two Final Fantasy games.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Final Fantasy VII had no plot, and Final Fantasy VIII played like a Jane Austin Novel. Final Fantasy IX regurgitates every possible cliche in history, and draws out these cliches for hours.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Overall, the effort put into this games plot must have been minimal, making the game highly unmemorable.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The towns, castles, and dungeons look just as real as the ones from FF 7 and FF 8. This makes the characters look out of place--especially in FMV sequences--because the characters are deformed looking.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The battle music is better the the previous two Final Fantasies, but other than that, it's all pretty unmemorable.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Character themes are mellow and boring.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Story -- 4 This is easily the weakest element in the game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: It is about a boy named Vivi who doesn't know anything about his past and spends the whole game discovering the exact same things that Terra and Cloud discovered in Final Fantasy 6 and 7. Oh, and Garnet also discovers her past through a series of flashbacks that establish her as something that we the player already knew from the first few hours of playing the game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Zidane is a girl crazy teen who's idealistic immaturity is as boring as his one line pickups.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: He has no depth.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: At least pretty boys Locke and Squall had depth and plot backing them.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Zidane seems thrown into the game as a marketing tool to entertain the 13 year old boys who will be purchasing this game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Other side characters are completely recycled and poorly developed compared to there older counterparts.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Eiko is a Relm (FF6) character who takes up too much plot fawning over the sexy Zidane (oooh, monkey tails...), and Amarant is like a dummied down Shadow (FF6).
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Quin is of course the Gogo character, only stupider.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The main characters fail to hold the players interest as well.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Princess Garnet (aka Dagger), in Square tradition, is the magic using chick that was born from some special summoner race, yatta yatta.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: You've seen her many many times before, only the last few times you saw her, she was interesting.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Rydia from FF4 held our interest because we got to see her develop from childhood to adulthood in an epic.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Terra's character pulled at our heart strings as we saw the oppression of her people, and the effects of being a slave to the scientific horrors of the empire.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Even Aeris from FF7 touched us when she was killed by Sephiroth.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Dagger just simply exists in this title, and is so predictable, that her story could have been summed up in about 20 minutes of the game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Square gave us the ever annoying ''Active Time Event'' (ATE) in this game to give us, the player, and opportunity to see the character interact outside of the party.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Weee. The ATE adds so little to the plot, and takes up so much time, that it seems that Square added them to take up time and disc space.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: I know what Square was attempting.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: They were trying to develop the characters through a series of normal events.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Unfortunately, the ATEs add so little to the game that they almost interrupt the game when they occur so frequently.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Now for the actual plot of the game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Disc one is spent going between the different characters, introducing them, and creating highly staged situations in which the different characters end up coming together.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Zidane is the main character, however we don't really spend much time getting to know him.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: This may be due to the fact that his character consists of ''Don't be mad, we are all friends,'' or ''Hey baby, you look lovely today.''
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: There really isn't anything to the main character, which is unfortunate since we spend so much time with him.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Since he is a thief, why not make him more devious.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: There are points in the game where he admits to abuse he suffered in childhood, and that is why he became a thief.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Why not expand more on that story to give his character more of an edge: making him distrustful, perhaps bitter, or even insecure.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: None of these factor into his character however, and we are left with a thief so lifeless and boring that we wonder what all these love sick girls see in him.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The Villian is a total rehash of FF6 and FF7. His character is pointless and arbitrary to the game as a whole.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: He is thrown in to give us a villian.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: There is no real motive behind his evil, and he starts out as a powerful almost indestructible god.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: This is unfortunate since it alerts the player of who the last boss shall be.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Why not just alert the player by saying ''Hi, I'm going to be the last boss in this game, or at least one of the last bosses.''
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Square's ''old school'' attempts went to waste since there really wasn't anything ''old school'' about this game--not plot wise anyway.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Final Fantasy 4 and 6 were noted for their originality and ability to draw players into the game for hours at a time.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: As I played this game, I just wanted to hurry up and beat it.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Gameplay -- 7 Well, Square fixed some things...
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: a few. At least the characters are somewhat different from one another.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Only some characters can use white magic, some black, some summon, and the rest have their own special attacks.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: I like this system much better than junctioning and materia and even espers.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: You still get AP points and learn powerful abilities through weapons, which makes the gameplay a little easy.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: By the middle of the game, all of the characters have so many abilities that they are practically immune to every statis effect.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Magic is learned very very slowly in this game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Instead of limit breakers, characters have trance which gives them a powerful ability that they can use.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Also, you can use four characters in this game again, although it is still a step down from the five characters you could use in Final Fantasy 4. Weapons are primarily bought in stores, or forged together to make new weapons.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Dungeons in this game are EXTREMELY short and only take long because of the random encounter every step and a half.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: And speaking of battles, this game is one of the easiest Final Fantasies ever.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: I never died playing this game.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Bosses are simple, regular battles are simple, yet annoying since they take so long to load.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Level gaining is quick, and irrelevant since it seems to not matter what level the party is at.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: As long as you save all your most powerful spells for the bosses, the game is a breeze.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: What is with Square and having the characters do 9999 damage regularly?
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: This makes the game way too easy.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The battle system is a step in the right direction after the last two FFs, but it is still rather uninspiring.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Perhaps Square should attempt to create a new type of battle system that offers more intriguing strategies.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: At least the draw system (although it was weird and a little dumb) was an original idea.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Replay -- 2 Long, Boring, and pointless.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: When the game is over, you feel numb, as if you have watched 3 Disney movies in a row.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The game could essentially pass as a Disney movie.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: This Final Fantasy was extremely dissappointing, especially since I had such high hopes for it.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The whole ''the crystals are back thing'' sounded nice...except that you don't bother with crystals until disc 3! The characters were beyond cliche, beyond trite, they were flat, like cardboard cut outs, or movie extras.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: The story was poorly developed and executed.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: At least Final Fantasy VIII gave us characters that we could focus on.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: At least Squall had an angle to him.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Hell, even Cloud, the soldier who barely talked and had no recollection of the past seemed more real than any of the characters in FF9. I guess the only thing ''old school'' about this game was the lack of plot.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Why not just redo Final Fantasy 1? None of the characters talked at all in the original Final Fantasy.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: Without all of the pointless chitter chatter, we would be allowed to beat the game quicker.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: All in all, I hope Square tries a little harder next time.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: This game could have been prevented.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Sentence: I wish I hadn't bought this game, and so will you.
Name: videogames_neu_16

Name: videogames_pos_3

Name: videogames_pos_3

Name: videogames_pos_3

Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: You can easily master your character after a while, so don't worry about the controls.

Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: As for the game difficulty, it's not a really hard game, but it's no piece of cake!

Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: If you are a person who get scared really easily, you might find it a little scary...I did!
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Score: 10/10 Story - Count Dracula has again arisen: Cornell, a strong man-beast, ventures into Castlevania to find his kidnapped sister and to destroy Dracula.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Pretty good story, and if it seems simple, don't worry; you will soon get into it.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: But it doesn't end here!
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Seven years after Cornell's quest, three warriors are also following his path, as the darkness arises again.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Henry, a boy whom Cornell had saved, Reinhardt, a descendant of the Belmont bloodline, and Carrie, a girl with magical powers, also venture into Castlevania and each have their own story.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: In addition to Count Dracula, Cornell, Reinhardt and Carrie all have a second enemy who will taunt you during the game, so this is no boring story!
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Score: 10/10 Graphics - The graphics aren't the best I've ever seen, but they're still quite good looking, and they are by far better than average graphics.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Castlevania really looks like an old castle, and your characters are really well-designed.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: The places never look the same, which is a good point.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: The lightning effects are particularly good, and so does the fog.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: During night time, you can see the red moon up there in the sky, which looks almost real.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: The enemies look so real, you really think you have a three-headed dog in front of you:) Score: 9/10 Music/Sound - Though the music might get annoying (sometimes), it's still really great and it fits with the atmosphere of the place you are in. It really makes you ''get into the game''.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: There is all kind of music, and depending in which kind of place you are, you can get calm music or rock-like music.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: You will have all your time to enjoy it, as there is usually one different music for each different stage in the game.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: This makes the game even scarier.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: As for the sounds, they are almost perfect.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: The lightning sounds really good, and you can hear your character walking, attacking, getting hurt or dying and the enemies moaning, fighting, growling or yelling in pain after they take a hit or die (especially the vampires' death, it sounds so cool!).
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Score: 9.5/10 Play Time/Replayability - The good point about this is that you have four characters to complete the game with: each has to take a different path to complete their tasks, so the game will last quite a long time for even a good player.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: However, once you've done a stage with one of the character, you will most likely have to go through it again with another sooner or later: there are only two stages that are unique to one player: the others are going to have to be completed two, three or even four times, which makes the replay value not really good.
Name: videogames_pos_3

Sentence: Unless you're a huge Castlevania fan, you will surely get bored to do the same thing over and over again, so you might not want to play it again.

Sentence: Without a doubt the most well designed game I have yet played.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: It is NOT a sequel to Starcraft, and it is NOT an AoE rip-off either.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: It is the most original RTS game out there, as it adds in a role playing flavor with the advent of Heroes, special characters each of the races have.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: Many people claim that the heroes are unbalanced because they are so much better than normal characters, but that is a stupid statement.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: They are very powerful, but everyone has 3 of them, and they balance each other, being the same costs/availability.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: They each have their roles, and the ways they interact with their allies and opponents is a large part of the game.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: All in all I think the game is a sophisticated chess match, and like chess takes many hours to master, so don't buy this game if you are short on time.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The game play is incredible for two reasons.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The first is the Artificial Intelligence, which is amazing.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: Not so much as your computer opponents AI when you play the single player games, that AI is weak.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: But the AI that controls your troops in battle, responds to your commands, etc. is probably the best I have ever seen.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The ability to put spells on auto-cast (and the effectiveness of the AI at deploying them) is amazing.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The way troops react is so realistic it is unparalleled.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: You really spend most of your micro-management on the heroes (you usually have 2 at a time, which makes the game just micro-intensive enough to be hard, but not so much as too make it frustrating.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: It seems like other games have either little micro needed or too much, but this game finds a happy median.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The second thing that sets this game apart is the 4 races.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: Some people complain that other games have more.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: But in those other games, they are usually all too similar, they are just the same groups and have mostly the same stuff, but some of their stuff is stronger than other factions and some weaker (maybe their air attack is strong but their troops weak).
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: This usually makes only one or two factions dominant, as one aspect tends to be overpowering.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: No such thing in WarCraft 3. Granted, each faction has similarities.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: But the differences are much greater, and so well balanced that you see each faction represented among top players almost equally.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: Any race can truly beat any race.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The graphics are sweet.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: Even on medium, which I have them on, they look excellent.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: The simple fact of RTS games is that graphics aren't that important anyway.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: True, you like to be able to distinguish your units, but for the most part it's kind of like chess, who cares what they look like; you only care what they do.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: But don't get me wrong, the graphics on this game are incredible, I've ran them with a GeForce4 TI 4200 128 mb on high everything it was very impressive.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: It just isn't a big deal to me in an RTS.
Name: videogames_pos_12

Sentence: I was a first year AP US teacher when I purchased this book and another by the Princeton Review. Both books are intended to be complete resources for reviewing for the AP Exam, but the Princeton Review is substantially better in all areas.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: The selling point (I thought) in the REA book was the "Six full length practice exams" it advertises.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: Though these tests are long, the questions are simplistic and are little like real AP questions.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: Most only require the student to know a definition.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: The essay questions are acceptable, but instead of explaining different approaches to writing the essay and evaluating the sources (like the Princeton Review) this book simply gives example essays.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: The biggest failing is the lack of depth about the AP test or proper strategy.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: The first chapter of the Princeton Review goes into great detail about how to prepare and what strategies to use on the AP Test. This book does have lots of questions on US History, but I would recommend using free resources (like old AP tests) over purchasing this book.
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: Better yet, get yourself the Princeton Review book!
Name: books_neg_79

Sentence: Impeaching Mere Creationism is an attempt to debunk the intelligent design and creation movements.

Sentence: SOLOMON'S KEY THE CODIS PROJECT: A CONSPIRACY THRILLER
Name: books_neg_104

Sentence: Michael Behe has stated (in interviews) that he does not agree with a 'materialist' explanation of nature.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Materialism means that we take the view that only forces and matter are what determine physical phenomena.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Behe takes the view that something else is involved - something best described as Supernatural.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Yet there has been no repeatable experiment (eg prayer freezes water) to demonstrate a non-materialist position.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: But get this...
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Behe has said that if scientists were to discover some non-materialist phenomena, they would keep that discovery a secret!
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: First of all, it is open to anybody, not just scientists, to show that materialism it not a complete explanation.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: And to hint that scientists are keeping (or would keep) supernatural explanations secret completely misreads what science is all about.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Science is about empiricism.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: It's just that so far, nothing at a basic, repeatable level, has demonstrated anything other than matter and forces are at work.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Arguments for design always start at the top (complex systems), which misses the point completely.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Any sensible understanding should begin at the bottom (simple repeated experiments), and Behe does not demonstrate that a non-materialist explanation is necessary.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: Until he, or anyone else, can do so, it is a waste of time to argue about intelligent design.
Name: books_neg_110

Sentence: This book alleges scandalous, hideous misdeeds on the part of distinguished scientists such as Napoleon Chagnon and James Neel. But all of the book's main accusations have been thoroughly refuted, and the only genuine scandal here is the way the author, Patrick Tierney, has fabricated and distorted reality in order to sell some books.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: The anthropological reputation of Chagnon remains intact, unlike those of anthropologists who have endorsed this dishonest, tabloid-calibre book.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: The book's egregious distortions and errors were first discovered in the manuscript, and I was expecting them to be corrected in the final version, but nope, they all appear to be there.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: How deeply disturbing that a book such as this could be published by a respectable publisher, endorsed by anthropologists, and even be nominated for a National Book Award. If Tierney was just honestly presenting evidence of wrongdoing, that would be fine.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: Never mind that it would trash the reputations of the developers of the measles vaccine (Enders, Katz), the world's most important pioneering geneticist (Neel), and the world's greatest scientific anthropologist (Chagnon), and cause their friends and families to suffer.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: Such evidence would deserve an audience nonetheless.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: But this is not what Tierney does.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: He distorts his printed sources, omits evidence in these sources that refutes his accusations, and invents material that isn't actually there (there are currently many web sites which document this dishonesty in a point-by-point manner, although Amazon asks that reviewers not include URLs in their reviews).
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: And that's just the sources that CAN be fact-checked - who knows the extent to which he misrepresents his uncheckable sources on which his accusations depend (mission records, interviews, audio tapes, etc.). In fact, several of Tierney's interviewees have already come forward and said that Tierney does not quote them faithfully.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: On the positive side, Tierney's got a smooth narrative style, and the book might make a nice novel.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: So read it if you want - just consider it fiction.
Name: books_neg_113

Sentence: Author Elizabeth Pace uses the scientific differences between men and women to help sales associates and entrepreneurs learn the best practices for dealing with different genders.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: the premise is; if you can market properly to men and women, you will be able to increase sales and expand your business.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: I really enjoyed this book.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: Pace gives us many tips and access to research to help us deal cross-gender.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: She tells us things like men are more driven and strait forward when it comes to sales.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: They do not want interruptions and need to get right to the point.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: Women, on the other hand, want more connection and community when it comes to business relationships.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: Women will deal with (or add to) the conversations and interruptions if it means a group can come to a consensus.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: The only place I found this book lacking was in the "spiritual content" department.

Sentence: Thomas Nelson is a Christian publisher and prides itself on having a spiritual message.

Sentence: If they did not, I would not be picking at this point.

Sentence: It would have been nice to see a link between gender-specific sales practices and proper Christian ethics.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: Maybe a chapter on how men could treat women with respect during a sales meeting (trust me, I witnessed the degradation of women in many a sales meeting) or some way women can deal with the constant sexual marketing happening today.

Sentence: Overall, it was a good book.
Name: books_pos_83

Sentence: I enjoyed reading sections aloud to my wife and more than once getting that "ah-ha!"

Sentence: moment as I found something that related both to business practices, and my personal relationships.

Sentence: Communication in marriage is a challenge.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: I am grateful, then, for Dr. Emerson Eggerichs' book, The Language of Love and Respect: Cracking the Communication Code with Your Mate (Thomas Nelson).
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: In it, Dr. Eggerichs expands the principles in his best-seller Love and Respect, and offers practical steps for couples.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: My husband and I have read several marriage books over the years...some good, some bad, and one so terrible that Andy actually threw it across the bedroom into the trashcan...but Love and Respect is our favorite, by far.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: It just makes sense.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: Biblical sense.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: Dr. Eggerichs bases his communication solution on Ephesians 5:33: "Each one of you also must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband."
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: A woman's greatest need is unconditional love, while a man's is unconditional respect.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: "Yes, the two of you are very different," Eggerichs writes, from God's perspective, "and I am telling you to love and respect unconditionally anyway."
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: Good communication in marriage isn't easy.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: It takes work, and grace, and power from beyond ourselves.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: But the biblical, practical advice in The Language of Love and Respect helps us speak one another's language, and grow a God-honoring marriage.
Name: books_pos_127

Sentence: First off the CG (as I expected) is gorgeous to say the least.
Name: dvds_neu_58

Sentence: If you're a fan of the game you'll be happy to know that the movie recreates it's futuristic world to a tee.
Name: dvds_neu_58

Sentence: The beautiful church with the flower pile will give you some nostalgia if you're a fan of the series, as with the infamous although brief "bathing of Aeris" scene (Aerith if you live in Japan).
Name: dvds_neu_58

Sentence: The characters themselves are immaculately detailed and are representative of their in game counterparts, and the free flowing clothing and hair on each of them will make you say "wow" at least once.
Name: dvds_neu_58

Sentence: The effects in the action segments are noteworthy as well, featuring vibrant colors and creative lighting.
Name: dvds_neu_58

Sentence: Musically, Nobuo Uematsu's talent translates into movie form fairly well, and feature some of the more noteworthy tracks from the game with some original content thrown into the mix.

Sentence: But these aren't the worst complaints I have with AV. Plot wise, AV struggles to develop anything that could resemble an engaging masterpiece.

Sentence: To sum it up without revealing any details, there is no real character development.

Sentence: Adding insult to injury, staple characters of the game such as Barret and antagonist Sephiroth are given little screen time.

Sentence: If you can surmount that disappointment, it should be noted that the studio clips are mostly of extremely poor quality (as if photographed from a tv screen).

Sentence: On top of that, the film has an amateurish quality (a not-very-similar-looking actor plays Rock speaking from the world beyond, sometimes with his image inserted into the frame with the real Rock Hudson).

Sentence: THE LOST CITY (2006) *** Andy Garcia, Ines Sastre, Tomas Milian, Enrique Murciano, Bill Murray, Dustin Hoffman, Millie Perkins, Nestor Carbonell, Steven Bauer, Richard Bradford, Dominik Garcia-Lorido, Julio Oscar Mechosa, Juan Fernandez, Elizabeth Pena, William Marquez, Tony Plana, (Dir: Garcia) Andy Garcia's Bittersweet Valentine To Cuba Andy Garcia has always been a favorite of mine to watch on screen, with his fiery, impassionate no-holds-barred, cool-as-a-cucumber performances with both excessive and implosive turns and his passion is now on full display in his directorial debut, a valentine to his beloved homeland Cuba. Garcia stars as Fico Fellove, a nightclub owner and musician in Havana, circa 1958, on the cusp of the Cuban revolution and a drastic turn of historical events that will forever change his heart and soul.
Name: dvds_pos_40

Sentence: The ones that possess and fight for both of these are namely his loving family led by the patriarchal Federico (Milian), a good man of professorial status at the university and his caring wife Dona Cecilia (Perkins), who still insist their family meet for Sunday dinners promptly at six o'clock with no excuses.
Name: dvds_pos_40

Sentence: Those providing the turmoil are his brothers Luis and Ricardo (Carbonell and Murciano respectively) who consistently are chomping at the bit with their disputes about the impending revolution and the desire to remain a patriot despite the odds of Communism infiltrating the masses.
Name: dvds_pos_40

Sentence: Fico remains the peacekeeper and will not tolerate any disrespect towards his decent-hearted father but the dam will only hold for so long as the siblings go their separate ways.
Name: dvds_pos_40

Sentence: When Luis is killed in an attempted coup-de-tat assassination on loathed Presidente Batista (Fernandez) Fico can only see the writing on the wall when he allows his heart to open to Luis' widow, the beautiful Aurora (Sastre); the two fall in love and marry.
Name: dvds_pos_40

Sentence: Shortly thereafter things get worse when Ricardo has fled to the deep jungles of the covert military ops of Fidel Castro after he was arrested and beaten by the corrupt chief of police, the vile hand crop bearing Colonel Candela (Mechosa) who has slain Luis. Fico knows this but is powerless to do anything, which makes the tragedy unfolding even more devastating for him to burden himself with.
Name: dvds_pos_40

Sentence: Garcia does an admirable job in capturing the flavor of the late 1950s look of the imbroglio-to-be with an elegant production design created by Waldemar Kalinowski and gorgeous cinematography by Emmanuel Kadosh that does justice to his ideal yet struggling nation under fire.

Sentence: He hasn't been making a lot of films in the past few years but whenever he pops up you immediately are focused on his kinetic energy, the arched eyebrows not unlike Nicholson's (side note: I always thought it was divine intervention when they were cast in BATMAN since they had so many mirror image physical ties!)
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: and glib, self-deprecating wit that acts as a shield from his inner demons his characters often try to keep at bay.

Sentence: His latest is no exception.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: Based on a story by acclaimed author Don DeLillo (who adapted the screenplay), Keaton stars as a New York bred playwright who's latest work is to dawn on the fated October 1986 evening of the World Series where his beloved Boston Red Sox' lifetime curse gets re-enforced by the infamous ball-between first baseman Bill Buckner's legs.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: But I'm getting ahead of myself.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: Nicky Rogan (Keaton) is facing many cross-roads: his new play is about to premiere on Broadway but Rogan's dilemma is whether to avoid the possible public crucifixion by the notorious critic Steven Schwimmer (Downey in a wonderfully daffy turn) whose perchance for theatricality (he attends his works in masquerade since he has been virtually vilified by all who know him) sharpening his fangs to sink into his baby or watch the drama unfolding of his aforementioned team in the defining moment of baseball.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: Along the way he is avoiding his family, namely his wife Lillian (the equally gifted O'Hara) who is requesting a divorce and their teenage daughter Laurel (a great Graynor) whose dabbling into the punk era underscores her dad's rebellious nature in namely a heated affair with Joanna Bourne (a nubile Neuwirth) who is also giving Nicky an ultimatum.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: To make matters worse he runs into an old colleague, Elliot Litvak (an unkempt and funny Dunne) who is downward spiraling fast after a devastating debacle in the form of his last attempt at a play that was skewered by the hated Schwimmer to the point Litvak can quote chapter and verse of the bilious critique that has him fixated to the extent of dementia.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: Nicky grows increasingly wearier as the day becomes night and after a short visit with his father ("The Sopranos" ' Aldredge) figures to ditch the premiere after all (especially when his leading man - the always welcome vet Yulin - whose addled brain can't get its grasp on a key line reading) and ducks into a local bar to add insult to injury and watch with melodramatic hubris his beloved Sox get theirs.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: Filmmaker Hoffman does a yeoman-like job in getting fine quality performances from his gifted ensemble and in his star, Keaton gets a few juicy yet low-key turns as well balancing the tension that is leading to a possible fall-out.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: Smartly shot on location in Manhattan the city acts as a character as it normally does providing just enough backdrop to its proceedings at hand.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: DeLillo has a fine gift for his literations and the parallel of Nicky's play - a quasi-autobiography about his relationship with his working class dad - with Nicky's family life shows a man, flawed, yet genuinely wanting to make things work.
Name: dvds_pos_54

Sentence: THE TV SET (2007) *** David Duchovny, Sigourney Weaver, Ioan Gruffudd, Judy Greer, Fran Kranz, Lindsay Sloane, Justine Bateman, Lucy Davis, Willie Garson, MC Gainey, Philip Baker Hall, Andrea Martin. Tart Satire of TV; Duchovny Gives Great Deadpan Jake Kasdan's latest satire, "THE TV SET", is a pitch perfect , dead-on depiction of the myopic vision of American television which has become a vast wasteland of so-called 'reality' shows and mean-spirited game shows when in essence, the true pillars of its foundation, the scripted format is on the wane.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: Never before has a sharp-edged black comedy been needed to poke at the underbelly of the medium than now.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: The filmmaker cut his teeth on TV including the much critically lauded, hastily dispatched "Freaks & Geeks, that his insider voice is on full display for biting the hand that fed him and for rubbing its ilk in the mess its created.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: To wit: veteran scribe Mike Klein (Duchovny giving deadly dead-pan, is a study in noble rot) is desperately trying to get his current project "The Wexler Chronicles", a dramedy based in part of his real-life brother's suicide's affect on him, past the pilot stage for the fictitious Panda Network (think CW lite) and the biggest hurdle is vacuous, yet tenaciously 'my way or the highway' Lenny (Weaver, a dry riot), a harpy in a suit, who is not Mike's biggest fan but has her current junior exec Richard McAllister (Gruffudd in a modulated turn of a decent guy in a deceptive business), a Brit late of the BBC, whose come to LA for the network to give a fresh perspective on the new crop of shows for the seasonal line-up.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: He too is hedging his bets but mostly due to his domestic dilemma of not being there for his family while juggling the powers that be with the promising sitcom-to-be.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: Mike is plagued not only with the cluelessness of the execs but is shortchanged when he is forced to go with his second choice for the show's lead character, Zach Harper (newcomer Kranz, suggesting a lame-brained Jake Gyllenhaal); an inept director (Garson); his airhead manager Alice (Greer) who backpedals everything thrown her way; his pregnant wife (Bateman making a nice return to film here) his only support system but a constant reminder of the price of failure; and one lulu of a recurring, crippling back ailment.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: Kasdan layers everything with a touch of stinging wit, caustic dialogue, and unbelievable accuracy of how some people truly are so incredibly dense to the matters of the creative process it's a true wonder how the hell they got so far (let alone dressed themselves in the morning and made the effort at a daily life!)
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: Duchovny's Mike Klein, behind a thatch of itchy/scratchy beard as a mask of indifference to what is thrown at him knowing ultimately he will have to acquiesce at basically every power play and sign his soul away to get his baby on the air; truly soul-crushing to watch one's lifetime dream become a living nightmare.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: While not a classic like "The Player" or even "Network" the film works on its own merits by not caving in to be likable either; Lenny wouldn't have it any other way.
Name: dvds_pos_62

Sentence: FACTOTUM (2006) ***1/2 Matt Dillon, Lili Taylor, Marisa Tomei, Fisher Stevens, Didier Flamand, Karen Young, Adrienne Shelly. (Dir: Brent Hamer) Dynamite Dillon excels in Bukowski adaptation Matt Dillon, believe it or not, is one of the more versatile American actors around since his hey-day cocksure anti-heroes of the '80s ("Rumble Fish", "The Outsiders") who can do it all, comedy ("There's Something About Mary") and drama ("Crash" which earned him a Best Supporting Actor nomination last year) and he continues his journeyman vocation with a humdinger performance running the gamut of human emotions.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: In this big-screen adaptation of the acclaimed writer Charles Bukowski's rough-and- tumble works of self-emulation Dillon stars as Henry Chinaski, the loosely based on the author's persona, a drifting writer on the skids who takes the occasional odd-job (the title refers to a man who does many tasks) to compensate his lifestyle of heavy drinking, chain- smoking and general carousing.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: He can barely sustain a moment's interest at the menial labor he is offered often resulting in his immediate firing usually while imbibing at a local watering hole, indifferent to the dismay and anger of his employer.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: Chinaski is a free-spirit whose laconic demeanor is only sublimated by his desire to be a well-respected writer who continuously sends his unsolicited works to literary periodicals with the usual rejection notice (or worse, no reply what-so-ever) as he aimlessly pursues his next haunt.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: Along for the ride in one jaunt is Jan (Taylor nicely balancing the destitute of Chinaski with her own unique blend of shabbiness), a loose woman Henry falls for and wind up sharing space and libations until the money runs out.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: The two make for a winning pair of losers, each oblivious to their falling apart and frequent dismissals of the other when in fact they are one and the same: soul mates.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: Newcomer Hamer allows his actors plenty of room in the seemingly improvisatory sequences of dry humor sprinkled out (he co-adapted with Jim Stark, one of the film's producers) and absurd twists to a scene (Dillon's laid-back narration sparks many of the underscored moments of hilarity at hand โ ie explaining Jan's shoddy car's lack of functioning headlights only to work when the equally malfunctioning springs to the car in affect bounce them on!)
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: A good combination of a skilled director with some interesting compositions and his actors having fun in the process (Tomei is a loopy lush in a glorified cameo and Stevens as a degenerate gambler befriended by Dillon).
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: Kudos to the grimy yet clear-eyed cinematography by John Christian Rosenlund, Eve Cauley's earth tone sepias production design and the right-on-the-money period costume design by Tere Duncan giving it a timeless late '50s โ early '60s vibe.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: But again it is Dillon who gives an Oscar worthy turn as the charming, irritable and barely awake Chinaski that deserves recognition proving there is more to meet the eye in the once โthought-of-one-trick-pony that Dillon was initially perceived for his heavy Brooklyn accent and blank brooding good looks; he does his best work since changing that tune with "Drugstore Cowboy" and hope he continues his trek of good fortune unlike Henry Chinaski.
Name: dvds_pos_74

Sentence: KEANE (2005) **** Damian Lewis, Amy Ryan, Abigail Breslin.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: (Dir: Lodge Kerrigan) William Keane (played with heartbreaking brilliance by Lewis an Academy Award worthy turn) is a man wrestling with ultimate grief: he is searching for his lost little girl months after the incident that has sent him into a downward spiral into mental illness.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Keane patrols the hustling bustling Port Authority Bus Terminal of New York City where he was with his daughter when he took his eyes off her for a brief moment only to lose her possibly forever.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Months have passed and apparently Keane has been plagued by his absolute guilt in allowing her to be taken from him that it has affected (or possibly triggered) a panicky, inner voice that speaks to him (or more accurately has him speaking aloud to himself either calming his fear or invoking more paranoia) as he wanders seemingly aimless in the unforgiving way station (a perfect metaphor for his situation), replete with a tattered news clipping about his missing daughter that he waves to unsuspecting passersby and pedestrians alike milling about their daily chores of going back and forth to work or another destination.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: He is met with disdain, indifference or plainly ignored.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Keane is in hell.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Living on a disability check and residing in a New Jersey flophouse Keane manages to daily sojourn back and forth hoping for a glimmer of recognition (is that her purple coat in the distance?)
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: that he lathers himself into a feverish foam of hope (or worse fearful pessimism) and finds himself getting a cheap drunk on in a bar trying in vein to listen to "Sugar Pie Honey Bunch (Can't Help Myself)" on the tinny jukebox to either assure him or drown out his inner rage (unnervingly maddening); having anonymous sex with a stranger in a throbbing club's restroom; scoring cocaine to amp up his courage to go on; staggering the street howling his daughter's name and sadly returning to his empty room to sleep a dreamless, troubled sleep soothing himself between wracks of sobs of pity and horror.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: One day Keane sees a single mother and child (Ryan and Breslin, both excellent) arguing with the desk clerk over money and he ingratiates himself by offering her a hundred dollars to get her by (earlier he is shown in a near similar sequence) and Lynn and Kira invite him over the next night for a takeout dinner.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Lynn informs Keane that she and her adorable daughter are en route to Albany but are awaiting her husband's word that he has located a new suitable home for the family.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Keane recognizes in himself what he used to be โ a father to a young girl โ and becomes a defacto member of this temporary family when Lynn asks him to watch over Kira and the results are heartbreaking.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Filmmaker Lodge Kerrigan has created a truly amazing, deeply felt emotional roller coaster exploring the inner corridors of mental health, family values and the human condition that he touched base on a similar theme in his stunning debut in 1994 with "CLEAN, SHAVEN" featuring a schizophrenic (character actor Peter Greene, best known as the racist/rapist doomed Zed in "PULP FICTION") attempting to keep his demons at bay in his search for a daughter he never met.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: The real miracle is Lewis who in a perfect world would be a natural bet for a Best Actor nod (and win) but this independent film is small in scale (and distribution so far despite it being executive produced by acclaimed filmmaker Steven Soderbergh).
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Lewis, who shined in HBO's mini-series "BAND OF BROTHERS" and was the best thing in "DREAMCATCHER", a British actor who uncannily channels an American accent every time, is an underrated thespian who truly gives a stunning, shocking and ultimately sympathetic performance.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: Sure he has all the staples of a 'crazy' role: talking to himself, sudden outbursts of near-violent rage, crying himself to sleep etc. but he never allows this to overtake the fact that William was a human being and that this tragic turn of events has him in a stranglehold only fueled by his desire to be free of this ongoing (and possibly self-afflicted) curse.
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: We are never 100% certain if in fact he had a daughter but I'd hedge my bets that Kerrigan is too sharp to fool his audience into false beliefs (I recognized one gut-wrenching clue when William mentions to a ticket clerk he lost his daughter on September 11th) particularly Lewis' gentle interplay with the natural born Breslin, a very excellent young actress who also shines in her sad, shy Kira, a child who is suffering as well inside and eventually blossoms into happiness and can see that there is more than meets the eye with William (who's final act has all the suspense of a melodramatic thriller in what the audience fears his truth to become).
Name: dvds_pos_90

Sentence: The words "I love you" have never resonated so much overwhelming emotion that if you are not in tears then you my friend are not human.

Sentence: Based loosely on a novel by Brett Halliday, "Bodies Are Where You Find Them", the story focuses on small-time petty New York City criminal Harold "Harry" Lockhart (Downey also making a fine comeback to comedy in a well-suited performance tailor made for his fast-talking, sharp minded spite) who winds up an unlikely actor wanna be when a Christmas-time burglary attempt has the pursued by cops Harry bolting unannounced into a late-night film audition where he finds himself overwrought with guilt of his partner's demise which adds hilarity to his 'motive' when he reads the script shoved into his hands which just happens to be a policier (!) and the casting agent Dabney Shaw(funnyman scene-stealer Miller) hires him on the spot.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: Harry is next whisked to sunny LA by Shaw for meet-and-greets to create serious buzz and enlists the unexpected thief a lesson to be a detective with Shaw's for hire gumshoe "Gay" Perry (Kilmer equally having a ball and a natural flair for tongue-in-cheek humor), a tougher than he appears homosexual who is reluctant to have the flaky Harry tag-along to get notes for his 'character'.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: But since he's on Shaw's permanent payroll he has no choice.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: Enter equally unlikely meet-cute Harmony Faith Lane (the luscious Monahan, who makes a sexy funny performance cook to perfection) a childhood friend from Harry's past who shows up at a party that both Harry and Perry are attending for Shaw. Seems Lane has always pursued her dream to be an actress and ever since they were kids playing magician and assistant (guess who and guess who) she came to La-La-Land with little fanfare and a broken heart.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: Harry's unrequited love for Harmony is re-ignited and soon finds himself (and Perry) embroiled in a murder case when one of Perry's employer's daughters winds up killed.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: The odd couple begrudgingly decides to follow through on some seedy leads and soon wind up to their necks in dead bodies and hot water.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: Black's sharp, skewered and outrageous humor percolates like a heady witches' brew of goofy insouciance effortlessly in the hardboiled tradition of Raymond Chandler which he spoofs with the wry narration Downey does throughout and upending the apple cart of the pulpy fiction noir genre with gleeful gusto.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: The two leads are funny, fast-witted โ like a modern day Hope & Crosby with cool to spare and do the best work they've both done in recent memory.
Name: dvds_pos_95

Sentence: Downey makes an affective coward/jerk/good-hearted schnook while Kilmer coasts on his pretty boy charms with a nod to straight men like Bud Abbott and Dean Martin โ street smarts and flair to spare.

Sentence: Monaghan proves also to hold her own and has a deft comic timing too and being easy on the eyes sure as hell doesn't hurt.

Sentence: This drive is embedded with Western Digital's SmartWare virtual CD that will ALWAYS and FOREVER boot to your Mac computer.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: This Virtual CD cannot be disabled, unmounted, removed, eradicated, or partitioned away - EVERY!!!!!
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: It says so right on WD's website buried in the tech support area, not on the box where this kind of "don't-buy-our-product" warning belongs.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: Western Digital has decided to embed their Virtual CD Smartware into this drive so that you cannot, under any circumstances, disable or remove the VCD. It will forever mount this unwanted intrusion to your Mac (Windows is no better apparently) and their website essentially tells you that you can do nothing about it.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: Can you tell that I am upset?!?
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: I own seven other Western Digital hard drives and I will not own this one.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: Nor will I buy another in the future out of fear of getting the same results.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: Like many people, I have no need for their backup or security software as I just want external drivers for pure storage.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: If I were to buy more of these like I had planned, My desktop would be cluttered with a bunch of meaningless virtual CDs. This intrusion may not annoy Windows users as the Virtual CDs will just clutter up your "My Computer" window; but, on a Mac this type of unalterable intrusion is beyond unacceptable.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: I cannot believe that Western Digital could not see the alienation of every Mac user on the planet from ten miles away on this one.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: Western Digital and other drive makers have, for a while now, put their software install packages onto the external hard drives that they sell; but, it has always been just stored on the drive where it can be deleted or is removed when the drive is reformatted - at worst it was on a separate partition that could be removed.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: But, not with this new version (version 3?) of the My Book Essential Drives where it is embedded into the drive's hardware and cannot be deactivated.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: Until Western Digital rethinks their strategy and changes this practice, their hard drives should be avoided and boycotted.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: (For more information, see all of the review on the 1TB version of this drive.)
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: UPDATE: After returning the Essentials drive, I purchased two of Western Digital's Elements External 1TB Hard Drives; Exactly what I needed in the first place...
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: an external hard drive that is built like a tank and is only what it is supposed to be: a hard drive.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: No "fancy" value-added software embedded in the hardware to muck up the works on this drive.
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: I highly recommend the Western Digital Elements external hard drives for all of your storage needs!
Name: electronics_neg_59

Sentence: This is my third Bluetooth device in as many years.

Sentence: I wanted this one because of the portable charger/case.
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: THAT feature is great!
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: Makes the headset easy to carry along with cellphone, without throwing it in my purse and accidentally having it turn on and call back the last number dialed.
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: Also it sits nicely on a countertop, making the set less easy to lose.
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: The headset itself easily turns on and off (which sounds like a simple function, but wasn't all that easy on my previous two Bluetooths).
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: Two things I don't like....1)the headset isn't very comfortable for longer calls--my ear starts to hurt if it's in for more than a few minutes.
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: 2)this could be a deal-breaker: In the middle of a conversation, even with the cellphone within a few feet of the headset, this Bluetooth sometimes disconnects itself, and the call has reverted back to the cellphone.
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: Actually, this does make problem 1 less of a nuisance--since the headset time is shorteded by the BT's refusal to stay in the conversation.
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: Would I buy it again?
Name: electronics_neu_22

Sentence: I tested this camera in all types of lighting, yet it rarely took outstanding pictures.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: It doesn't let you adjust the apperture settings, and it always tends to make terrible automatic lighting choices.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: In a situations where it should widen the apperture, it never does.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: It tends to favor longer exposure times.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Being a person who likes natural light better than a flash, I always turned it off.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: And, thus, I wound up with blurry or dark pictures.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: After hundreds of pictures and a week of giving it every chance to prove itself, I gave up.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Back to Ritz it went.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Even in relatively good lighting conditions, it chose horrifying exposure times like 1/6 of a second.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: ??? In room lighting it even chose 1 second exposures!
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: It lets you adjust exposure + or -2, but the pics look terrible!
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: I'm sorry, but somebody with a pocket camera is NOT going to be carrying around a tripod to make sure their pics aren't blurry.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: I can't use a camera that not only doesn't let me control something as simple as the apperture, but it makes bad choices about the lighting.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Even in bright daylight, in the shadow of a pine tree, the jitter light was on because it was choosing horrible exposure times!
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: BTW- the jitter light is on about 90% of the time with this camera.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: I guess you just have to live with it.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Now, even so, this is a good camera.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: 1. The colors are natural and accurate.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: 2. The pictures are amazingly clear.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: 3. The auto-focus is next-to-perfect.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: 4. The battery life is impressive.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: I would take in excess of 100 (more even) shots without a recharge fully using the lcd screen.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: 5. The screen size is a pleasure.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: 6. It's fast!
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Okay, my conclusion is this: this camera is a beautifully engineered piece of camera.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: It's amazing.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Unfortunately, it takes terrible pictures because of something that would have been so easy for Canon to fix.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: My pictures did NOT live up to ANY of my expectations.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Thus, you're always cursing about how you'd prefer to apply your own pressure to the brake.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: Sorry Canon. Maybe the next Elph will be better and I'll buy that one.
Name: electronics_neu_24

Sentence: I've been using the Treo 700W for three months and I absolutely love the set of features it offers.

Sentence: I have two major complaints about this phone.

Sentence: First of all, it's like Windows 95 -- I have to "reboot" it every day -- and I don't have any extra software installed other than what comes with the phone.
Name: electronics_neu_36

Sentence: People will frequently tell me they called and got voice mail but my phone did not ring -- when I try to turn on the phone it won't turn on.
Name: electronics_neu_36

Sentence: I have to remove the battery cover and use the stylus to push the reset button.

Sentence: If it's going to lock up that much, at least they should make the reset button more easily accessible.

Sentence: Second, my favorite feature, the voice commands, frequently just doesn't work.

Sentence: But 80% of the time you push the button and nothing happens.
Name: electronics_neu_36

Sentence: Very disappointing.
Name: electronics_neu_36

Sentence: Bento is a smart, convenient database for the non-power user.
Name: electronics_neu_40

Sentence: Within its limitations it's excellent, interacting automatically with other apps (like iCal and Address Book) on the Mac. It also simplifies database use in general for those of us intimidated by full FileMaker.
Name: electronics_neu_40

Sentence: Unfortunately, it lacks some capabilities a lot of ordinary Mac users will want - primarily the ability to sync data among multiple Macs. If you keep Bento on your desktop you can't readily sync its data to the same app on your laptop, or vice versa.
Name: electronics_neu_40

Sentence: Makes it tough for use in a mixed environment.
Name: electronics_neu_40

Sentence: Online discussions have highlighted this shortcoming, and we can hope the first revision will overcome this limitation.
Name: electronics_neu_40

Sentence: Meanwhile, if you do all your computing/database use on a single machine, Bento's fine.
Name: electronics_neu_40

Sentence: I bought this printer to serve a small work group of 4 employees, 3 of whom use Macintosh notebooks.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: I specifically chose this model because it was marketed by Canon as fully supporting Macs. My experience with the printer is that 'support' is an exaggeration.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: It can be made to work with Macs, but not all the time, and certainly not if they are running Snow Leopard.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: Leopard works fine, with the exception of faxing from the computer which I found impossible to get working, even after several hours on the phone with Canon tech support.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: Snow Leopard is currently unsupported as of the time of this review.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: To be fair, the MF6595 works flawlessly with all Windows operating systems, including Windows 7 Release Candidate.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: Windows support includes a wonderful installer that automatically locates all networked printers and installs the correct drivers for them (which is nice since we have 2 other canon printers in our office: IR1023 and a 4080 with H1 attachment).
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: I don't know why Apple doesn't program a similarly useful installer for Mac hardware.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: My experience has been that getting a Canon printer up and running with Windows takes 5-10 minutes.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: Getting it up for a Mac can take numerous hours and several phone calls to tech support.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: It's pretty frustrating.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: The printer itself works great.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: It's fast, printer high quality black and whites, and the scan function is fine if you're not doing too many sheets at once.
Name: electronics_neu_66

Sentence: Since the printer is missing a auto-loading document feeder scanning multiple pages can get tiresome, so if that is important to you, go for a different model.
Name: electronics_neu_66

But like all electronic equipment, (LCD, HDTV, TV monitors, and digcams), you have to adjust the controls (PICT.ADJ) to get the best picture, or a picture set to your personal preference; you know-contrast, brightness, sharpness, etc... well, the FZ30 has controls that when adjusted properly, practically eliminates the so called 'noise' problem.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: Remember 'noise' is part of digital technology and all digital cameras have 'noise'- yes DSLR do too, it's inherent in the technology (pixels).
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: Just like all film cameras will show grain, noticeable under low lighting conditions with film.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: So, reducing grain in the best of cameras has to do with the film, lighting and the photographer.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: It's the same with reducing 'noise' in digital cameras.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: If you are getting 'noise' simply set the Pict.Adj to [high noise reduction], use a flash, tripod, or play with some of the controls and learn how to use the camera and lighting to eliminate noise.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: If the picture on a TV is grainy you adjust the sharpness, contrast etc. the FZ30 is of the same technology (digital/electronic) and has similar menu's.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: And just as a pro photographer takes great pains by using high power lights and accessories like flash, tripods etc. in low lighting situations even with his high priced camera, high priced lens and thousands of dollars worth of equipment to get a fantastic shot (He doesn't blame the camera, just as an artist doesn't blame his brushes for how his pictures turn out)!?
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: Well, simply learning how to adjust a few menu options in the FZ30 and learning when and how to use the appropriate accessories will get you almost the same results with the FZ30 a $500.00 camera as with a $5000. camera.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: Yes, for the money and features this is the best of the bunch.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: It does all you ask of it and more.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: So if 'noise' is your only complaint, learn how to use the camera controls, and remember it won't perform like a $10,000 camera with stage lighting, camera crew and a professional photographer, even if you think it should.
Name: electronics_pos_44

Sentence: But it does comes close if you know what you're doing!
Name: electronics_pos_44
