Sentence: Let me preface this review by saying that I don't hate Paul Oakenfold.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: I don't have a personal vendetta to pursue against him, and in fact I absolutely love Bunkka and Tranceport.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: That said, this album is very poor.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Oakenfold is one of the main reasons I began to love trance, electronica, and even dance.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: When I first heard Tranceport, I was amazed with what I was hearing, and began to dig into a whole new world of music I had never known about before.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: I owe Mr. Oakenfold a debt for turning me on to music I now love and listen to on a daily basis.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Unfortunately, Oakenfold has stumbled quite a bit in this collection.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: This is not a trance album.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: It is a collection of pop-happy fluff, filler, and unremarkable songs that simply don't appeal to me at all.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: I realize that opinions vary, and I'm sure I'll get lit up for writing a negative review, but I really felt obligated to let people know to save their money.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Most of the songs in this collection sound like club anthems that would be more at home on a Ministry of Sound collection of euro pop. Paul used to know how to mix soaring vocals with a killer beat so that both complimented one another perfectly (Southern Sun from Bunkka is a great example of this).
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Now it seems that many of the vocals are too heavy for the music, and the beat gets lost in the background.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Even the remix of Southern Sun found in this collection is inferior to the original.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Also, many of these tracks are just filler or fluff, such as the James Bond Theme remix which is listed on the Amazon track list as: "9. James Bone Theme - Paul Oakenfold, Norman, Monty" James Bone Theme is about right.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: I honestly can't think of a time when I want to listen to trance and I think to myself "You know what would be great?
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Listening to some movie soundtrack remixes!"
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: If this is a collection of Oakenfold's 'greatest' hits, then were are tracks like 'Gamemaster,' from Tranceport or 'Ready Steady Go,' from Bunkka?
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: Where is 'Zoo York,' and 'Get em up' also from Bunkka?
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: This is not a collection of his greatest work.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: It is a collection of meaningless, passionless remixes or pop dance tunes.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: If you loved Tranceport, don't spend your money on this CD. If you loved Bunkka, don't spend your money either.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: If you love movie sound tracks, pop remixes, or soft edged dance music, you might enjoy this CD.
Name: music_neg_67

Sentence: For a remix collection to be worth anything it has to add to, or do better than, the original tracks.
Name: music_neg_69

Sentence: In this case, Last Night was a pretty poor effort by Moby standards, and this remix collection is miles away from the brilliance of Play or the solidly constructed Hotel. Relatively bad songs remixed are still relatively bad songs.
Name: music_neg_69

Sentence: Moby's ill advised exploration of disco gets even worse here.
Name: music_neg_69

Sentence: This a forgettable collection that only the most dedicated of Moby fans will want to purchase.
Name: music_neg_69

Sentence: 1.5/5 stars.
Name: music_neg_69

Sentence: An uncommon misstep for Moby.
Name: music_neg_69

Sentence: While I am a huge fan of Beyonce, when I bought this record, I listened to it...and the very same day sold is for 5 dollars at a discount used CD store.

Sentence: Maybe this was a bit harsh, but after the grueling hour I spent trying to find quality music in this hip-hop/pop trash, maybe it wasn't punishment enough.
Name: music_neg_80

Sentence: Beyonce Knowles is a very talented woman: She is a good actress (which we are to see more of this summer), she has a great voice if put to good use, she writes catchy radio-ready songs and can produce like no one else.
Name: music_neg_80

Sentence: Maybe this is why the last Destiny's Child album, "Survivor", was such a success, Beyonce fully controlled the writing and producing of each track.
Name: music_neg_80

Sentence: On "Dangerously In Love", she hands some of the control over into apparently very unable hands.
Name: music_neg_80

Name: music_neg_80

Sentence: But the absolutely worst song on this album would have to be "Gift From Virgo"; Six minutes of Beyonce throwing her voice all up and down the octave chart with words so incredibly vapid you would think a valley girl with a 2.0 grade point average had written it.

Sentence: The most annoying thing about this song is she keeps changing pitch, about every 5 words or so we're hearing a new tune.

Sentence: It sounds almost like when you put a tape in a player and it eats the tape, and is just as enjoyable.

Sentence: The one song Beyonce seems to want to make a big deal about is "Dangerously In Love", a remake of the enchanting love Ballad first performed by Beyonce's girl group, Destiny's Child. This, I wouldn't have a problem with if it were a remake at all, instead of an exact replica.
Name: music_neg_80

Sentence: The only songs that are worth bearing at all are "Crazy In Love" and "Yes", an abstinance song I see making the top 40 in the future.

Sentence: But believe me, this is still not a reccomendation.

Sentence: If you want to hear Beyonce Knowles at her best, buy any of the three Destiny's Child album, and don't bother with an album that sounds like 40 songs had a car accident.

Sentence: It's saddening to see talent put to waste, both from Beyonce, her song writers and producers who usually make such great music on their own.

Sentence: Let's just hope they lose each other's numbers.

Sentence: If this CD is "remastered", it certainly was not from the 1st generation, multi-track session tapes.
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: From listening to this CD, I can hear distortion and an audible amount of tape hiss, especially through the quiet passages of "I've Grown Accustomed To Her Face".
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: And after all these years, we STILL get "Mexican Shuffle" in MONO!
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: Which leads me to believe that this, and other TJB CD's in Herb Alpert's Signature Series, were mastered to CD directly from the original mixdown album masters that were used to press the original A&M vinyl LP's back in the 1960s (a common practice that was routinly done by the record industry with past album masters during the dawn of the CD era 25 years ago, which magnified the imperfections of analog album masters on CD).
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: In this day and age of today's advanced digital technology, a golden opportunity to digitally remix and remaster some of the greatest music of the '60s, was missed.
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: I liked the idea made by a previous reviewer when he stated that remastering these CD's in both STEREO and MONO, just as Capitol did with The Beatles box set of the first four Beatles' Capitol albums, would have been nice.
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: Maybe Universal, given time, would have done a much better job at remastering these early A&M classic albums.
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: I say this because, in my opinion, I think the people at Universal are doing an outstanding job at remastering some of the Motown material (ie "The Motown Box").
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: Sorry Herb, but I think you missed the boat with this series.
Name: music_neg_97

Sentence: Many music listeners today don't realize that back in Robert Johnson's day (1930's), a musician played a lot of parties as his primary gigs, and whatever the partygoers wanted to hear, he was expected to know how to play (that is, if he wanted to be paid well and keep working!)
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: A tune such as "They're Red Hot", a blistering swing/ragtime/cakewalk number more reminiscent of Louis Armstrongs Hot Fives & Sevens rather than the repetoir of a legendary blues Delta slide player like Johnson, might be featured along side more typical Johnson fare like "Come On In My Kitchen" or "Hellhound".
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: Surprise, Surprise!
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: Billy Preston's tinkling piano and Jerry Portnoy's wonderful harp provide the musical highpoints.
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: Most of the other songs are saddled with sludgy, over-reverential takes that lack soul and life.
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: What happened to the great live-in-the-studio feel of From The Cradle, another all-blues masterpiece recorded just ten years ago to much better effect?
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: Sounds like Mr. Clapton was in his Safe Eric mode, offering exact reproductions without fire, combustion or chemistry.
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: For example, compare Eric's lame take of "When You've Got A Good Friend," with Savoy Brown's excellent version from their 1999 album Blues Keep Me Holding On. No contest: Guitarist Kim Simmonds and his famous Gibson Flying V fly circles around Eric's rendition.
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: And the remake of "Hellhound on My Trail," Johnson's signature tune??
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: What a disappointment!!
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: For this take, Eric should have sent the band home and played the entire song with acoustic and slide.
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: Sounds more like a rabid poodle on his trail rather than a hellhound!!
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: In closing, what can I say?
Name: music_neu_101

Sentence: This is a tough one.

Sentence: When I heard Mariรฉ Digby on NPR's Morning Edition Saturday with Scott Simon last year, I was so taken with her voice and style that I immediately downloaded "Unfold" from iTunes.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: The album was enchanting from open to close and most of its tracks remain in heavy rotation on my iPod.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Mariรฉ's passion, sincerity, and beauty came through loud and clear in well-produced but organic arrangements.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: I could listen to this collection of songs over and over without losing interest.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Mariรฉ is clearly a music wonk.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: She works hard at her craft and the success of "Unfold" garnered her a well-deserved higher profile.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: And she never stops!
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Look at the wealth of content on her YouTube channel if you think she's not among the hardest working musicians in the business.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: She was clearly keen to explore a new path.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: "Breathing Underwater" is the expression of this desire.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Mariรฉ is completely ga-ga over her new "baby."
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: And that's as it should be.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: But I must confess that the new album falls fairly flat for me.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: The acoustic production that made her stand out has been replaced with drum machines, multi-layering, and auto-tuning.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: The delicate, vine-laden garden lattice of "Unfold" has been replaced by a hard, brick wall of sound this time out.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Given the current state of mainstream music, she now blends in. I don't know why Mariรฉ would want to sound like so many other young women in the pop market.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: But that's where "Breathing Underwater" deposits her.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: In the end it's Mariรฉ's call, alone, as to where she takes her music.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: I have no doubt that "Breathing Underwater" will do very well for her.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: But it doesn't do much for me.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Did I buy it?
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: For $2.99, and given my affection for "Unfold," I could not resist.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: And I will listen to it several times hoping that something about it grabs me.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: "Unfold" grabbed me right away and has yet to let go.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Mariรฉ wanted to move away from "Unfold." I'll nourish a hope that she keeps moving; on to something different for her third album.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Perhaps something like Koop or old Zero7...? I'll still see her when she tours.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: That will likely be my best chance to hear acoustic versions of the new songs.
Name: music_neu_129

Sentence: Formed by a former Throbbing Gristler and a buddy, Coil is difficult to describe as anything but "experimental" and "electronic."
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: Some of their albums consist of little more than curious drones, while others are swirling with noises the hearer's mind cannot contain.
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: *Loves Secret Domain*, released on the now post-indie WaxTrax label and currently out of print, collects a number of melodic, pop-based "songs" (they actually are coherent, with beginnings and ends) that are at times profoundly dancey ("Snow"), goth-y (as with the title track), meditative and pleasant or just plain WEIRD (the rest of the album).
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: This their most accessible album tends to be their best, in my opinion (proof enough that these bois are capable of good, unpredictable, thoroughly enjoyable "pop").
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: *Stolen and Contaminated Songs* consists, literally, of songs ripped from the WaxTrax album and reworked.
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: This album is not as good nor accessible, but remains an enjoyable, second best.
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: Don't expect the sonata form!
Name: music_pos_34

Sentence: This set of 6 CDs takes the book of the Cosmic Jesus one step further.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: The book explores the Words of Jesus in their original Aramaic.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: The CD book takes those concepts and Douglas-Klotz' scholarship into the realm of the auditory.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: The author/speaker carefully explains the meanings of the sayings of Jesus in their original Aramaic then teaches the listener the language forms of the various words.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: He then takes it to the next step of providing chants for use in meditation.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: These chants are accompanied by modern but appropriate guitar music and enable the listener/participator to enter more sensually into the original language.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: This is an extremely useful set of CDs for anyone who wishes to develop their spiritual meditative life.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: Interestingly I would have expected that it would be suitable only for a Christian participator.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: However the understanding of the Aramaic words gives such a clear liberal theological and spiritual basis of the unity of the Creator that it is accessible to anyone of any religious or spiritual tradition.
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: Having used the CDs and having read the original book, I am also left wondering how "The Passion of Christ" a la Mel Gibson could use the Aramaic in order to present such a traditional conservative and violent view of the life and death of Jesus without leading the viewers into a more universal expression of compassion that is so evident in the CDs. Fully recommended
Name: music_pos_54

Sentence: First of all, let me elaborate on the term "melodic death metal".
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: I do not mean "Gothenburg" bands, but more accurately, Death Metal that contains some melody.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Now that we've got that out of the way...
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Anata is one of those rare bands that hasn't yet written a bad song.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: While most people are only familiar with their third album, "Under A Stone With No Inscription", I'm here to tell you that this album is every bit as worthy of praise.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: "Released When You Are Dead" opens the album in a deceptive manner, as it is easily the most brutal song on the album.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: It is still quality though, with a massive slow riff in the middle.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: From here the songs become more melodic, with vocalist/guitarist/main man Fredrik Shalin alternating between growled and screamed vocals.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: The third song, "Under Azure Skies", deserves a paragraph of its own.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: This, my friends, is one of the best metal songs I've ever heard, period.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Angel Of Death. Davidian.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Blinded By Fear. Under Azure Skies. It deserves to be mentioned in the same breath as these classics.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Beginning with slow, chugging riffs, it is after the first verse that it kicks into high gear, harmonies running rampant.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: But then the song breaks down into a bass-led melody, with Schalin at first almost speaking the lyrics, then screaming over the soft music.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: I'm butchering the description, but it's really a powerful piece.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: The song picks up again with more heart-wrenching harmonies, screams and pounding drums.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Simply godly.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: I could go on and on about this wonderful album, but I won't.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Instead, I'll just leave you to check out some of the music, and then maybe you'll buy it.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: Recommended like a rest after a hard day's work.
Name: music_pos_62

Sentence: In an earlier review I had stated that TD's "Melrose" was their most haunting since this one.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: Well "Hyperborea" is their absolute most haunting an surreal cd ever in my book.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: It really does, as reviewer Morse put it, take you on a visual journey-you really do feal like you are there.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: I actually imagined myself amongst the pyramids and the Sphynx on the track 'Sphynx Lightening'.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: And on the title track, 'Hyperborea', I could see myself on a barren yet breath-taking frozen landscape.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: If you like a surreal sound, this is the one for you.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: And yes, as reviewer Morse also stated, you do have to listen closely for the subtle changes in style and tone(just when you think you are hearing a Celtic sort of sound, it moves on to something else and it challenges you to try and figure it out).
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: You could actually(and this may appall the most devout new age listeners!)consider "Hyperborea" 'nature music', for it does indeed transport you to natural locales and states of mind.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: Does that sound like someone on an acid trip?
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: Just buy it and you'll understand.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: And you should also enjoy it immensely.
Name: music_pos_66

Sentence: This record blows my mind.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: It is at once catchy, hummable and avant-garde.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: There are two big "wow" points here.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: The first is the "string," (le fil), a tone that persists throughout the entire record (and beyond, into secret-track land).
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: This literally ties the entire record together and makes you listen to it as a suite: not that the songs don't stand by themselves, but this persistent note just keeps pulling you into the next one.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: The second big thing is that it is arranged almost all a cappella.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: Yes, there are instruments.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: But no, the instruments don't take center stage.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: It's all about the voice, the human beatbox, and the clap.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: This gives the record a real organic feeling: it doesn't sound as if it was spit out of a hit factory.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: I am amazed at Camille's self-assurance in making a record like this that relies so wholly on her own voice to carry it.
Name: music_pos_101

Sentence: The lyrics are wry, funny, and thought-provoking, but in my mind are almost completely occluded by the breathtaking arrangements and production.

Sentence: Very rarely do you come across a game like this, and I'm extremely glad for this.

Sentence: The second installment in the Final Fantasy Legends series, is probably the worst, and later on, becomes physically painful to play.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Graphics : 5/10 Probably one of the nicest parts of the entire game, the graphics are nothing amazing, but nothing extremely horrible.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Story : 1/10 Here's where things start to go bad.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: You get woken up one night by your father, and he tells you about the 77 pieces of ''Magi'' spread across the world, that when put together form a statue.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: You, obviously, go in search of them.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Normally I don't have problems with simple stories, but when combined with the monotony of the quest, you'd think they would have written a better story, to keep you interested.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Controls : 5/10 Nothing really bad, typical GameBoy RPG controls, you'll get used to them very quickly.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Gameplay : 1/10 As you journey around, you have to battle against other monsters, and buy weapons/armour, like any other game.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: The only problem with FFL2 is the fact that you never gain a ''level'' you just randomly gain stats, which gets annoying, since you have to spend so much more time ''level'' building, than any other RPG I've played.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: And when you get to the later levels, and the monsters are extremely tough, this becomes even more annoying, with the limited weapons use.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: You have say ''hit points'' for each weapon, for example: You equip a sword, and it can only be used 15 times before breaking.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Now, of course, as you continue onwards, you find that weapons become even more expensive, and slowly begin having less, and less hit points, so when you do want to ''level'' up, you have to get new weapons every several battles, just to keep leveling up, which takes all your gold, which means to do anything else you need to go fight....
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: it's an endless cycle that becomes annoying in the later sections when you face up against some extremely hard boss characters.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Luckily, you do run into a few ''super'' weapons that don't have any ''hit points'' but they're very few, and by the time you find them, you've probably already grown sick of this game, and thrown it against a wall.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Sound : 1/10 A problem that seems to infest all the other GB FFL games, is the overly ''sad'' music.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Normally, I don't complain about music, but in most games, the tunes are at least halfway decent, and you can continue playing without having to have the game on mute.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: But with FFL2, the music just is so repetitive, and melancholy, even during the ''happy'' parts of this game.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Replay Value : 1/10 If you have enough strength to go through this game once, trust me, you'll never want to go through it again.
Name: videogames_neg_33

Sentence: Pros: The cover actually has Cornet on it.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Extra features after game play.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: ... Cons: No original illustrations to find.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: No ability to change from English to Japanese in the music/subtitles.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Original character expressions replaced with medicore digital drawings.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Gaming grid system is gone.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Took away game play settings.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Rhapsody: A Musical Adventure is one of my most favorite games of all time.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: It's not the most dramatic, or the most visually exciting, but it brings charm, hope, and a smile to my face when I need it most.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: I was certainly one of the most excited fans out there when I heard this game was going to DS, and the disappointment with all the features they left out of this game was appalling.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: One of the BEST features of the game is being able to change from Japanese to English in both the subtitles and music tracks!
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Why else would a fan want to play a MUSICAL GAME?
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Is that not the most important part, that the characters sing?
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Another issue is the loss of the original design illustrations.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Admittedly, I am an illustrator, but those illustrations were yet another golden cookie that added to my gaming experience.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Also with the illustration issue, the icons that represent the characters expressions when they're talking, were JUST FINE the way they were and I do not see how REDRAWING all of them enhanced the experience.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: What time they spent redrawing those expressions they could have used to maintain the original grid system format for the DS. A different issue is the gameplay settings: Easy(aka never played a video game in your life), Medium (aka played one rpg), and Hard (aka easy mode on normal rpgs) have disappeared.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Admittedly, I'm sure we didn't NEED the settings, but if anything, making Rhapsody HARDER or adding an experience booster would've better than eliminating the settings all together.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: Converting this game to the DS could have been a lot simpler and would have given the fans more of what they wanted.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: I wish that NIS America had done more polls to fans to ask what we wanted.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: We are still out here and you have ruined the artistic integrity for this game.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: I do like finally having Cornet on the cover.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: The original game had a spoiler for a cover.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: It is also nice to enjoy extra features after gameplay.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: I don't want to entirely slam this game for fans.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: I would love to have a new generation of girl gamers to be able to enjoy this (sorry guys, don't really see you playing this, no offense).
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: All the original character sprites are still here, as well as a beastiary and character display, but both of these additions do not qualify for forgetting about all the other subtle features that made the original game so popular for the so few of us that played it.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: The next time a company remakes a game for fans, THEY SHOULD ASK FIRST. BRING IT UP ON MORE FORUMS, WE WILL BE INTERESTED.
Name: videogames_neu_29

Sentence: "All flash, no substance" Let me begin by saying that I do not currently nor do I have any plans to actually go out and purchase NBA Live 2006 for the Xbox360.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: I do own the Xbox version of Live and this review is off of the NBA Live 06 Demo available off the Live Marketplace and the extensive time I was able to get with the game at the Microsoft Xbox360 Zero Hour event.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The most evident change from the last generation of consoles (PS2, Xbox, GC) to the newest generation is the graphics.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: To me it seems as though EA Sports spent a rather large majority of their time developing this game from "scratch" on the graphics.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The arenas, player models, crowds, coaches, lighting, and presentation are all the best I've ever seen in a basketball game.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: Yes, I do think they are way better in this game than NBA 2k6 for the 360. The reason I feel this way is because the textures used for the skin look a lot better, have more color, and the sweat graphics look more realistic.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The only problem I have with anything graphical are some of the transitions between animations in the game...
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: they just don't seem to blend as well as I had hoped.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: On the gameplay side, the difficulty settings allow for pretty good challenge between teams.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The default settings are a little too slow for my liking, but of course that can be changed.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: I gave this game a 6 for the gameplay because of the lack of features they included in this version of the game versus the Xbox 1 version.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: I mean no superstar moves, no dunk contest, where's franchise mode???
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The game seems to play more simulation type of bball, but the numbers at the end of a game don't follow.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: Maybe next year or the version for the PS3 will be what Live gamers were expecting from a next generation title.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The sound and presentation in the game are fantastic.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: The arenas feel alive and watching the game and the start screen is great.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: Finally, I have to give this game such a low value rating because all you are getting for a $60 game is a single game mode, basic season mode, online play, and create a player...
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: I don't think it's right for EA to expect people to pay $10 more for less content compared to the past console versions.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: It's like NBA Live without serveral of the features that make Live such a fun bball series.
Name: videogames_neu_38

Sentence: I've owned every Crash Bandicoot game ever, and am a big fan.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: This game is almost exactly like the old Crash Bandicoot platformers, apart from a few noticable differences.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: The graphics are better and run very smoothly, without a single hitch or framerate problem.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: The only thing is though, is that if you've played Xbox games with great graphics, Halo, for instance, then you will be disgusted by this games' graphics.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: Another thing-Crash does not play as well as he used to.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: Crash used to run- now he seems to run, but very slowly.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: He runs as if he has been running for 400 miles beforehand.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: Also, his movements and actions are very slow and he appears to glide when he jumps.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: Also, if you are used to the difficulty level of every other Crash Bandicoot game ever made (which is stupidly easy) then you will be surprised by the Wrath of Cortex. It is very difficult, and offers a great challenge, especially the boss levels.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: Other than these, The wrath of cortex is a very enjoyable platformer, with some great action moments and puzzles to figure out.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: The only problem is, if you enjoyed the previous Crash Bandicoot games, you may be disappointed by his laest outing.
Name: videogames_neu_40

Sentence: "Disappointing" The overall storyline of the game is held together by poor one-liners.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: The storyline is flat and uninventive.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: utterly disappointing.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: Asside from the storyline you have missions to complete.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: The only thing that holds these missions in context is the thin storyline, so it ends up being a mission-based arena game, with the difference that the arena maps are a bit larger than traditional arena games.

Sentence: The fighting is pretty uninventive, unless I totally missed the point.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: You basically have spells and weapons, then hack and slash your way through the enemies to the bosses.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: Finish the boss, move on to the next mission.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: The visuals aren't to bad, but then again, they're nothing new.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: Considering the relatively small size of the maps, the graphic detail could have been seriously improved.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: Even the special effects are lacking.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: I guess the sound wasn't too bad, but nothing out of the ordinary.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: If you want to play this, I recommend you rent it at the local Blockbuster.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: Don't buy it, its a waste of money.
Name: videogames_neu_43

Sentence: Zoo Keeper is basically Bejeweled.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: Most everyone and their mom have played Bejeweled.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: Which means, people have basically played Zoo Keeper. That doesn't mean the game is bad.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: It's actually a very good puzzle game.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: And man, that stylus control just makes you love the DS.Zoo Keeper's basic premise is to line up 3 or more same animals horizontally or vertically.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: This will make them disappear and anything above the animals in the line will fall to fill the space.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: There is a timer on the left side that you must keep from running out by capturing more animals.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: Simple, but addicting.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: The game has a very easy learning curve.
Name: videogames_neu_45

Sentence: A nice western-cartoon feel!

Sentence: Story: 8/10 (same as pretty much any western type anything) You are a former marshal....Bad ass dude...Well, a bunch of people want your land, along with all the land surrounding you...You kept refusing, so while you went to the store to pick up some supplies, and your wife's perfume, they murder your wife, burn down your house, and kidnap your kid!
Name: videogames_pos_20

Sentence: Challenge: 6/10 I found some of the puzzles pretty confusing...and challenging....The bosses you just treat in the normal First Person manor...The enemies are pretty simple...Just go out there, move around, and if you are good enough, you can dodge lots of bullets and shoot the bloody hell outta them.....
Name: videogames_pos_20

Name: videogames_pos_20

Name: videogames_pos_20

Sentence: Replay Value: 6/10 Depends....You might go on multi player and play with absolutely nobody....I can't remember a time when anybody actually played multiplayer.....Anyways....If you wait a few years and play it again...Or you might just wanna kill some cowboys in western clint eastwood style....
Name: videogames_pos_20

Sentence: In conclusion, I give this game an 8/10....It's a really good game....seriously....The best western game I've ever played....It's got a nice story (for an fps), and all sorts of other junk...This is the game for any western shoot em up lover or just a regular action/FPS lover....Hell, it's even good for people who aren't fans of the genre

Sentence: If Final Fantasy VII is considered the pinnacle of console RPGs, then Baldur's Gate is most definetely considered the pinnacle of computer RPGs. This is simply one of the best series of games ever made, and any RPG fan simply cannot afford to not play it (and since the whole series is available for a tenner, you don't exactly have an excuse not to do so!)
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: Pros: -One of the best RPG series ever of all time for ten pounds.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: I haven't seen a bargain like that for a while.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -Make your own unique character from scratch in Baldur's Gate 1, and then after completing the first game, import them into Baldur's Gate 2 for true continuity and continue the saga.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -100+ hours of pure RPG bliss, with an epic storyline to match.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -Although the storyline does follow a set path, there are no restrictions in party members.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: Does your childhood friend Imoen annoy the hell out of you?
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: Then dump her in the inn (or kill her if you are feeling particularly evil) and go off gallivanting with the Halfing pirate and insane necromancer instead!
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -A horde of sidequests that can distract you from the main story-path for hours on end.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -Choose your character's allignment (from 'goody-goody two shoes' to 'completely neutral' to 'murderous lunatic'.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -Unlike the original releases, every part of the series is just 1 DVD, which creates a lot less hassle.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: Cons: -Despite the fact the game comes on DVDs you still can't avoid disk swapping at certain parts if you install all the expansions.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: For this reason I'd put off installing the expansions until you're at a point when you can make use of the expansion content (basically end-game or when you reach the experience-cap).
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -Similarly to games like Black and White who let you decide to either be naughty or nice, the good and evil aspect isn't exactly balanced.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: Generally the rewards for playing good are superior to taking an evil option (and sometimes there isn't a clear-cut evil option available at all).
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: -Since Baldur's Gate 2 isn't able to check what characters are dead and alive during your playthrough of the first game, if you play through both games you might find characters who you accidentally got beaten to death by a pack of gnolls being A-okay again (and the story of the second game also assumes you had a certain party-setup which you probably didn't).
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: This can't really be helped though, since it would have been difficult to drive the story on if all the major characters were absent since you killed them during Baldur's Gate 1! But these aren't REALLY cons, just some of the things I spotted and said 'That could have been slightly better'.
Name: videogames_pos_33

Sentence: RPG fan or no, you have no excuse not to play this incredible series.
Name: videogames_pos_33
